law.catch_line: Every 6 months, each hospital and related institution shall file with the Board a report that:...

section.section:
The hospital or related institution shall:
Submit the report within 10 days of any action described in paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection; and
State in the report the reasons for its action or the nature of the formal accusation pending when the physician resigned.
The Board may extend the reporting time under this subsection for good cause shown.

The minutes or notes taken in the course of determining the denial, limitation, reduction, or termination of the staff privileges of any physician in a hospital or related institution are not subject to review or discovery by any person.
Each court shall report to the Board each conviction of or entry of a plea of guilty or nolo contendere by a physician for any crime involving moral turpitude.
The court shall submit the report within 10 days of the conviction or entry of the plea.

text.section: The Board may enforce this section by subpoena.
Any person shall have the immunity from liability described under § 5-715(d) of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article for giving any of the information required by this section.
A report made under this section is not subject to subpoena or discovery in any civil action other than a proceeding arising out of a hearing and decision of the Board under this title.

section.section: The Board may impose a civil penalty of up to $5,000 for failure to report under this section.
The Board shall remit any penalty collected under this subsection into the General Fund of the State.
